values: I made an Aquarium Blog. It is wonderful.
22

So, I had the interview with the regional manager and operations manager of Games Workshop today and it went really really well... now I'm just waiting for their answer... I'm going to go eat all my fingernails now.

"Thank you for taking the time to visit our recent Assessment Center.  We would like to schedule a second interview for you to meet with the hiring manager and Regional Manger.

Thank you for your continuing interest in Games Workshop as a Hobby Specialist.  You will be contacted directly by the Regional Manger to schedule the details."


FUCK YES HIRE ME!!!!!

QUIZ TIME

<lj-cut>

1. Are you taller than your best friend?
Not a chance in hell.

2. Do you have a favorite type of pen?
big black ones.

3. Look at your planner for March 7th, what are you doing?
Probably flaying Warhammer Fantasy with a bunch of smelly people since it's Friday.

4. What color are your toe nails usually?
Badly chipped black.

5. What was the last thing you highlighted?
Uhhhhh... the edge highlighting on a Cadian Baneblade tank? (heh, I rock)

6. What color are the curtains in your bedroom?
Hideous and utterly useless light blue.

8. Have you ever had a black and white cat?
When I was very small... his name was Mouse and he was bigger than me.

9. What is the last thing you put a stamp on?
Probably an overdue fucking utilities bill.

10. Do you know anyone who lives in Wyoming?
Nope, but my Mom was hit by lightening there in the 60's.

11. Why did you withdraw cash from the ATM the last time?
To pay for my awesome hair cut and glaze by Rachel in Olympia.

12. Who is the last baby that you held?
Oh christ... uhhhh.... errrr.... probably like years ago.

13. Can you spell well?
sumtymez I r gud att it.

14. Do you like Cinnamon toothpaste?
Yes, but I'm the only one in the world.

15. What kind of car were you driving 2 years ago?
I was either carless, or had just gotten my current car.

16. Pick one: Miami Hurricanes or Florida Gators:
Are those natural disasters/fauna or sporting teams?

17. Last time you went to Six Flags?
Senior year of Highschool.

18. Do you have any wallpaper in your house?
No, thank the gods.

19. Closest thing to you that is yellow:
Disgustingly, Greg's pillow cases.

20. Last person you gave a business card to?
Probably Jon... begging him to distribute them... you want one? I do weddings...

21. Who is the last person you wrote a check to?
Either my drugged up landlord or the city of Tacoma... both of which can go die in a fire in my opinion.

22. Closest framed picture to you?
A really awesome Japanese calligraphy that Greg got from a visiting artist who was randomly in a sushi restaurant on New Years Eve in Greg's hometown.

23. Last time you had someone cook for you?
Jon made Tikka Masala a couple of days ago... and then we had leftovers.

24. Ever seen a giraffe in person?
Indeed... it was tall.

25. How many emails do you get in your inbox daily (excluding spam)?
Fuck... like 1?

26. Last time you received flowers?
Uhhhh.... for something? Probably from Greg if I judge the dried roses in the living room but it's been too long to remember why I got them. (hint, hint)

27. where'd it go?
Where'd... what go? >_>

28. Do you play air guitar?
Only all the time... when I'm driving... in the shower... in line for groceries... at old ladies... all alone...

29. Has anyone ever proposed to you?
Yes, and it was poorly planned you jackass I hate you go die.

30. Do you take anything in your coffee?
Like 19 sugar packets and 25 creamers please.

31. Do you own any Willow Tree figurines?
I have no idea what the hell those are. 

32. What is/was your high school's mascot?
A mighty Republican Eagle... symbol of freedom and beer... worn by a slightly retarded guy with a wonky eye that was probably on welfare.

33. Last person you spoke to from high school?
Probably Nathan via myspace message... sad, eh?

34. Last time you used hand sanitizer?
At my parents house.

35. Would you like to learn to play the drums?
I'd like you to learn how to play drums... and then drum for me.

36. What color are the blinds in your living room?
No blinds, sickly creamy 70's drapes.

37. must be chillin with #27
wtf?

38. Last thing you read in the newspaper?
That Hillary is in trouble...

39. What was the last pageant you attended?
Miss Grays Harbor years ago rooting for one of my Mom's students.

40. Where is the last place you bought pizza from?
Garlic Jim's... or maybe Brewery City, I can't remember.

41. Have you ever worn a crown?
Yes. No details for that one.

42. What is the last thing you stapled?
WORTHLESS job applications because NO ONE will hire me.

43. Did you ever drink clear Pepsi?
Wasn't that like... decades ago? I don't think I was alive.

44. Are you ticklish?
Yes, but I kick really really hard.

45. Last time you saw fireworks?
Vaguely... we kind of missed the show thing because we are stupid and my Mom had a bum leg at the time.

46. Last time you had a Krispy Kreme doughnut?
Oh dear god... I've only had one and it was disgusting... and it was with Nick who is also disgusting.

48. Last time you parked under a carport?
The last time that my Buick moved... I pushed it into my parents carport about 3 years ago and it's still there.

49. Do you have a black dog?
Black and Tan with Silver dapple count?

50. gah! a threesome with #27 and #37!!
I hate the internet.

51. Are you an aunt or uncle?
No, I'm a lonely piece of crap only child.

52. Who has the prettiest eyes that you know of?
Greg's eyes are all liquidy brown with yellow centers, Jon's eyes change colors and are sometimes purple... but I think Wellington Longbottom has the prettiest little puppy eyes of them all.

53. Last time you saw a semi?
Probably careening down Highway 167 while I-5 was fucking CLOSED last night. How do you close a fucking interstate highway? HOW?

54. What is the last song you belted out in the car?
Heh... errr.... "Your Gaullish War" by Eluviete.

55. Do you have a little black dress?
Nothing I have is little because I'm a fat ass.

So... the final stage of my interviews to become a 911 dispatcher/communications officer are on Thursday.  Wish me luck... I'll be put in front of a board and questioned and such.  I'm pretty confident, but it's still rather alarming.
Awwwwwwwww..... so fleshy. THEY LOVE THEY HATEZ

Alright... I'd like some input, but I have an opinion: I think that the HBO special Elizabeth I was much better than the recent movie Elizabeth: The Golden Age. Anyone?
Take the quiz at dicepool.com
Holy titwamp batman!  Jon starts at the Tukwila Games Workshop store on the 29th!!11!  50% discounts whoo!

And now I give you... very sleepy little Junior Officer Wellington Longbottom on his first day home! He's our new 10 week old AKC black and tan with silver dapple miniature Dachshund boy! He likes to play... he likes to chew and he likes to sleep.
Meet the little Dachshund puppy we're bringing home on Monday!! /cute overload

So tired.
Well... tomorrow is my big last day of working for the state.  I've spent all day tying up the loose ends... finishing the transcribing process on the surveys for this month, cleaning out the car, freaking that I've forgotten something huge.

It's going to be weird to not have a job... I mean... I had a lot of free time with this job, but I was always forgetting something.  There has been a feeling in the back of my mind for the last 6 months that I've got something due... or something I'm forgetting.  It's actually a hell of a lot like college... weird, eh?  Unfortunatley, that feeling was usually right... I usually was forgetting something.  I don't even know how many times I forgot to fill out my time sheet, or my mileage trip ticket, or lost my keys, or missed the thousands of phone calls my two supervisors flung at me.  Argh.  Sometimes I felt like I was the worst employee ev4r, but after talking with a lot of people about my woes... it seems like everyone feels that way.  It's going to be nice to just relax... and clean the house top to bottom, heh.  

The upside, however, is that I'm going to get to collect unemployment for the first time!  :)  Wooo free money!

I need to CLEAN.  Greg's parents are coming up from San Francisco Sun-Tues... there must not be any dirt!!!  Also... I need to hide everything in our house that has a caloric value higher than 120.  >_>

Other than that... I'm in supreme crunch time getting survey data finished before the deadline of October 1st.  I need to finish about 5 days from August and ALL of September.  GAAAHHH!!!!!

Still trying to get ahold of someone to schedule me a freaking interview at Best Buy.  Apparently the person is off today... and called my house line instead of my cellphone when I was away at my parents all evening last night.  /cry  
Please hire me!

Jon has the 4th level of his Games Workshop interview at 5pm tonight.  It involves a full 1850 game of 40k against the regional manager in the Tacoma store.  w00ts!!  It would be so freakin' sweet if he got that job...

Oh yeah... it was payday for Greg and I so we finally got to buy groceries and house care junk, heh.  zomgz we have butter and flour now!  I'm planning on making some sheer black "over" curtains for the giant ones in the living room with our new FREE (whee!) sewing machine.  Me + creamy striped 70's curtains = die.
PICTURES OF TEH KITTEH!!!!!!!!! The adorable: And slightly disturbing:
Looky looky: I swear to you... this will be tasty in about a year. Awwwww.... a man and his booze. 4 1/2 Gallons of joy.
Our encampment in the evening And don't forget to: Greg being serious in his pretty new garb Jon as Jorundr the Jolliest Viking Viking rumble and some more... Geirkr Moolfson, Slayer of Garbage

Woots back from Autumn War.  Tired... not hung over anymore after a lovely recuperating sushi evening.  Now... time for movie watching and ignoring the GIANT pile of stinky garb moldering in the enteryway and the sticky bunch of feastgear colgealing in the car.  Mondays are for cleaning.  >_>

Urgh.  Just got home from a marathon of days at my Mom's house (right after working out of town for three days).  I went down and picked fruit Sunday, Mom had surgery Monday and I've been helping her around the house/farm ever since becaue Dad was out of town.  Thankfully he got home late last night so I get this partial day at home to prepare for another work week.  This week I'll be doing a string of 5 ten hour days because I'm saving up comp time for the Autumn War SCA event.  

Lots of driving ahead of me:
8/30/07 Central Puget Sound - Everett Marine Area 8-A
8/31/07 Columbia River - Mouth of the Cowlitz River  
9/1/07 Mayfield/Riffe Lakes    
9/2/07 South Puget Sound - Point Defiance Launch 
9/3/07 Lake Washington - Gene Coulon Launch

It's good to be home... I'm not sneezing every 4 seconds from the insane cat hair and dust that seems to cover every surface in my Mom's house.  Gah.  I didn't know I was going to be down there so long... so I didn't have enough clothes to last me so many days.  :(  I feel gross even with the showers.  /cleanme

My tattoo is almost completely healed, but it's at that itchy annoying phase... I'm also really tired of lotioning my freaking chest every hour.  < W2Bhealingz20g >
Well... I guess I'm off to organize clothes for my exciting worky fish week and dig out garb and camping junk for Autumn War (w00t w00t).

Well... I'm off to work for the weekend. All weekend overnights. Meh. /shrug The tattoo is healing up fast... linework > fill in for healing factor. Linework hurts a hell of a lot more, though, so it's a tradeoff. Our blueberry port is bubbling away in its brewing bucket and the beer (I have no idea what kind) that the guys made has finally started to pop the airlock... even with a little nervousness about the yeast treatment. Whee! Ermmm.... not too much going on with me really. I get back home on Sunday and I'll take the rest of the day for lazing about and getting laundry done. Monday I'm meeting my Mom and Aunt in Olympia for another of Mom's skin cancer prevention/control surgeries. Small one this time... in theory. >_> Luckily it's only abnormal cells, not full blown malignant melanoma like the one a couple years ago. Meh. Curse my genes. /fistshake My kitten has sunburned herself in the windowsill and is now all peely. It's icky. But of course she's scratching the hell out of herself now... so I need to find some sort of moisturing sunblock that's safe for kitties/babies to eat and be slathered in. Any moms out there that know some secrets? I watched Beowulf and Grendel... which is a state co-sponsored Ontario-Norway film. It's held up in box offices in Canada really well... so I'm not just biased on the account of the male lead being a sexy beast (Beowulf... not Grendel). I recommend it for the awesome garb and armour and the cute little Nordic ponies. Also watched The Incredible Journey of Mary Bryant which was beautiful and sad and awesome. It's sad... and she's extremely used, but it's really an awesome story about a real life person... with embellishments and blending, of course. (Shhh I still liked it) Okay... that's all for now. Wheeee Thursday!
I finally got my collarbone tattoo!!!!!!! It hurt. It's pretty. This is my attempt at zen. This is my "ouch" face.
Happy Birthday to mine! Whee new clothes and tasty bath stuff and jewelry and NIN CD and whee! Tattoo on Tuesday!!!
Wheeeee!   Blueberry Port in the making must stage!

So... I just returned to Tacoma after a looong worky week. On Thursday I went to Vantage (it's a tiny little dust town on I-90 past Ellensburg and before the Gorge) and got some work done. Friday morning I headed out on what turned into a beautiful car trip to White Pass. I stopped at fruit stands and collected various tasty things... and it was really nice weather so going up the back side of the pass was amazing. When I got to the summit I checked into the White Pass Village Inn... which is very cute and ski-lodgy. I had a studio unit to myself with two beds and kitchenette and foreplace and whatnot. After I went to Rimrock Lake to get a water sample and harrass some boaters, I met up with my Mom at the Leech Lake horse camp (which is about 2 minutes from the inn) and we went riding up the Pacific Crest Trail to the first little alpine stopping spot called Deer Lake. We've camped at that horse camp and gone up that trail several times now on different trips, and I've always loved it. We hadn't been back in probably more than 5 years due to college and money and time... but my mom just jumped at the chance to meet me up there. Dad showed up much later with their big ass Sprinter van that they use as an RV. Saturday morning I went around to the smaller local lakes: Clear Lake, Dog Lake, Leech Lake, Bumping Lake, etc. I didn't find much action for surveys, but at least I tried. Turns out my housemate Greg had been mandatoried for a double shift the night before, which means he takes the next day off, so I invited him and Jon up to Whiute Pass for some adventure. When Greg and Jon got there we went over to the horse camp and hung out for awhile... played some music, cooked up chicken sausage dogs and smores! Whee! In the morning Jon and I fell out of bed all stiff and lame and went to the little local store (okay, the only local store) and had fresh bagel sandwiches made for all of us. w00t. So tasty. I made them have a big breakfast because they were going to go hiking up the mountain... and they're just not used to that sort of thing. We met my parents at their camp and headed up the trail (Pacific Crest #2000 for anyone that cares) at about 11am. The first mile is nothing but switchbacks and pain... where we almost lost Jon, but they both stuck to it and made it up the 1,000 foot rise to victory. After that first horror show, the trail generally evens out... with random bits of climbing, but nothing to rival the switchbacks of the first mile. Mom and I were riding, Mom bareback because her horsey had gotten a saddle sore and me riding a new horse that I'd never met... and packing huge bags full of all of our stuff. Dad, Jon and Greg were all hiking... but Dad hikes a lot so he charged ahead with his binoculars to shout some elk. I think the trail is beautiful... insanely rugged and harsh, but the trees are HUGE and there are amazing little lush meadows and rocky ledges that appear out of the dust. There is light green moss hanging from every surface, eventhough it's really dry up there. We finally made it to the top three miles later... 5,200 feet... and had lunch at Deer Lake. Yay! One time my parents and I stayed up on that trail for 6 or 7 days and spent a couple nights at Deer Lake before moving on to Beosh Lake (I think that's how it's spelled) which is about another 10 miles. We didn't continue on to Sand Lake because the guys were tired (well, not my Dad... who went marching off to Sand Lake and a random offshoot trail and back to scout before lunch) and it was getting colder. You'd be surprised how freakin' cold it is in August when you're up that high... there wasn't any snow, but it was nippy. Anyway... we all piled into our seperate cars (I had my state car) and trundled back to Tacoma last night. We were going to watch Pan's Labyrinth, but we were just too tired. I assume we'll watch it today, but who knows. I know this post is long... but I don't care. If I cut it no one will read it. >_>

I fucking suck.  I can never remember to turn in my time sheet.  EVER.  GAH.  I'm an idiot.
I lose my keys, I wipe my surveys, I'm late all the time, I'm under quota, I'm behind in paperwork.... I suck.

Is this how life is for adults?  Am I going to be perpetually in debt, late, behind, tired and out of stamps for the rest of my life?

I want some cake.  I want some fat kid cake.

Yay!  The mead is wonderful!  We didn't even have to sweeten at bottling w00t w00t... so it's pure honey and no bad stuff.

We designed labels for our plum wine... and also got some pretty labels for our mead which Jon is doing calligraphy for.  We're in the process of dipping the corked tops in different colors of wax right now... and it's awesome.  When we find some plastic to sculpt in we're going to make a cool rune stamp for the tops.  Whee!

I know you want some.  >_>

This makes me feel a little more nervous about the way my cat sometimes acts -extra- interested in spending some time with me. Is it because she's trying to get me to notice a less than overflowing food bowl... or something more sinister? Dun dun duuuun....

Argh.  
I be restless.

Maybe it's the weather... something in it's perfect sunny blandness that makes me so agitated.  

What am I waiting for?  Work tomorrow?  Yay.  What an exciting prospect.  Maybe I need to bake something again today.  Wouldn't it be a sad state of affairs in my life if that was the thing to make me happy at this moment in time?

There's something very soothing about baking bread.  I don't know if it's just for women... but shaping a big ball of warm dough and waiting for it to rise is just... really satisfying.  Maybe it's the smell... some sort of imprinted "home" trigger in our brains going off... even if our mother never baked a day in her life (mine did, but it's food for thought).

In a half hour comes the best part... punching and rolling.  I love it.  Then I'm going to seperate my massive bread heap into little squares and fill them with left over lamb and turkey korma.  After another 15 minutes or so to rise with their fillings they go into the oven until they're the right color and smell (I don't do the timer thing for the end product).

/soothe
Oh look... a kitchen full of dishes from two days ago... just for me.  Thanks god.
She's more concerned about eating bugs than looking at the camera. Do you think my Dad's a little proud of his kid?
